intro: Symphytum officinale, commonly known as common comfrey, is a perennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and tall spikes of violet or blue flowers. The plant contains a high concentration of allantoin, which is known for its soothing properties. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used historically for healing wounds and reducing inflammation.
